intro: Enkleia thorelii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. Enkleia thorelii typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds.
